title: Recitation
text: A literature review does not just recite all the relevant sources, but instead critically analyzes research.

title: No difference between the two
text: A literature review integrates sources into a broader discussion, while an annotated bibliography provides individual summaries of each source.

title: Including all literature
text: A literature review includes only the most important sources, and builds a narrative with the sources.

title: Thorough dive into Field
text: An annotated biography is more about noting down sources, while a literature review selects relevant past research and integrates it into the relevance of the study.
